summary: This document is an email chain from September 2019 regarding the processing of digital evidence in the US v. Epstein case. It discusses the loading of data from a hard drive seized from Epstein's Manhattan residence into the Relativity review platform for privilege review, and clarifies the data's origin from a search warrant.

events.title: Data Extraction from Seized Devices
events.description: Materials on a hard drive were extracted from devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence pursuant to a search warrant.

events.title: Data Loaded for Privilege Review
events.description: Data from the seized hard drive was loaded into the Relativity platform and secured for a privilege review.

locations: One St. Andrews Plaza, New York, NY (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: Digital evidence was seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence via a search warrant.
The extracted data was loaded into the Relativity platform for a privilege review in September 2019.
The data discussed is specifically from the Manhattan seizure and does not include materials seized from the US Virgin Islands.
The correspondence involves an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York.
